page.title: 19The Pub,Ayot St.Lawrence
page.content: One of the oldest buildings,16thC, is{ {THE OLD SCHOOL HOUSE.}It was used as a school until 1912.Now it is a private residence,last owned by Nick Faldo,the golfer. The bars of {THE BROCKET ARMS }date back to the 14thC. The bricks of the fireplace are layed length ways then width ways which was the method at this time.There is a Tudor extension which includes upstairs bedrooms.A wall leans badly as the supporting tree was removed when an extension was built recently.The beer barrels still go down the original chute.The end of the secret passage has been bricked up.The pub is very popular,especially the buffet lunches,and is responsible for the congested lanes that anger the villagers!The pub is managed by Lord Brocket's nephew who lives in what used to be the post office,until 1977.
